results.title: Red Matildas
results.creator_credit: Sharon Connolly, Trevor Graham and Yarra Bank Films
results.brief_description: Through the lives of three women, Audrey Blake, May Pennefather and Joan Goodwin, “Red Matildas” explores the social and political conditions in Australia during the Great Depression - conditions of massive unemployment, widespread malnutrition and growing militarism at home and abroad, that provoked many people to political activity. May Pennefather served 12-18 months in the Spanish Civil War. Cinematographer: Laurie McInnes
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sharon Connolly, Trevor Graham and Yarra Bank Films

May Pennefather served 12-18 months in the Spanish Civil War. Cinematographer: Laurie McInnes

results.title: Fair go!
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions and Victorian Trades Hall Council
results.brief_description: Fair go! is a step towards meeting the needs of young people for information about their rights as workers. Using a fresh, entertaining presentation, the program follows the experiences of school-leavers Kelly and Sam, as they fall unawares into a series of near disasters in new jobs.

results.title: This is working
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight, Film Australia and National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee
results.brief_description: Aboriginal people suffer an unemployment rate six times higher than the white community. Shows Aboriginal people in New South Wales who are working on four different job creation projects. Features, amongst others, Bill Powell, Aboriginal Liaison Officer TAFE, Rose Kirby, Murrin Bridge Handcraft Industries, Des Simon, apprentice carpenter, Purfleet and Dallas Carberry, park management trainee, Orient Point.

results.title: One Last Chance
results.brief_description: By focusing on the events experienced by a typical probation officer, over a period of about a week, this film aims to provide the public with a better understanding of the role and work of probation and parole officers; and show how the probation and parole system operates.

results.title: Bread and dripping
results.creator_credit: Women's Film Collective, Margot Nash and Wimins Films
results.brief_description: The role of the women during the Great Depression has often been neglected in the telling of Australian history. Using archival footage, this film illustrates the hardships and the political struggles women faced in a time of political and economic upheaval.

results.title: More smokes less lollies
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong, Hilary Linstead, Timothy Read, Big Picture, Film Australia and M and L
results.brief_description: Edited version of “Fourteen’s Good, Eighteen’s Better” and sequel to “Smokes and Lollies”, this is the second part in a planned four part longitudinal study of three young women in Adelaide who reflect on their past and futures as 18 year-olds: one single, another married and expeecting her first baby and the third divorced with two children. Each discusses her teenage years and attitude to marriage, sex and abortion. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gillian Armstrong, Hilary Linstead, Timothy Read, Big Picture, Film Australia and M and L

results.title: Flamingo Park
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Frazer, Clytie Jessop, Australian Film Commission and Women's Film Fund (Australia)
results.brief_description: Shows the works of two artistic and talented Australian fashion designers. Jenny Kee’s colourful designs are inspired by the tones of the bush, birds and flora, whilst Linda Jackson’s inspiration comes from the ocean and the sealife. Jenny’s designs are made up into outstandingly colourful handknitted garments, whilst Linda uses chiffons, cottons and appliqued designs.

results.title: The Passionate industry: 1920-1930
results.creator_credit: Joan Long, Frank Bagnall and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “History of Australian Cinema Series”.
Traces the history of the Australian film industry in the decade 1920-1930. Includes material from fifty newsreels, sixteen feature films and still photographs drawn from our seventy collections. The program looks at the 1927 Royal Commission of Enquiry and Film Bill of 1927, as well as footage of the Regent, capitol and Old State Theatre of Melbourne.

results.title: Highway improvements
results.brief_description: Details of planning and improvements of Victorian state highways, including climbing lanes for slow traffic, duplicate pavements, elimination of railroad crossings and development of by-pass roads.

results.title: Now you're talking
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Anthony Buckley and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of Australian Cinema Series”.
The 30s saw the introduction of the “talkies” and a new era of filmmaking began. This was to decline with World War II. Excerpts from many of the films made during this decade are seen in this video. Please note that the commentary by Leo McKern has been recorded on another channel and may not be heard over the original sound recording. Includes b&w sequences.
